Notes: Founded as the University College of South Wales and Monmouthshire . Merged in 1988 with the University of Wales Institute of Science and Technology . Merged in 2004 with the University of Wales College of Medicine .

Formed by the merger of University of Wales, Newport (1975, with origins in 1841) and the University of Glamorgan (1992, with origins in 1913) in 2013. Also incorporates the Royal Welsh College of Music & Drama
Founded as the University College, Swansea
Founded as the University College of North Wales
Founded as the South Glamorgan Institute of Higher Education in 1976, formed from the merger of four earlier institutes including the Cardiff School of Art & Design (1865).

English Name: University of Wales Trinity Saint David
Welsh Name: Prifysgol Cymru, Y Drindod Dewi Sant
Location: Cardiff , Carmarthenshire, Ceredigion , London and Swansea
Notes: Formed in 2010 by the merger of University of Wales, Lampeter (1822), Trinity University College (1848) and Swansea Metropolitan University (2008, with origins in 1853)
Founded as the University College Wales
Founded as the Wrexham School of Science and Art
